title: A Topological Characterization of Modulo-ğ‘ Arguments and Implications for Necklace Splitting
abstract:
Abstract
The classes PPA-pğ‘p have attracted attention lately, because they are the main candidates for capturing the complexity of Necklace Splitting with pğ‘p thieves, for prime pğ‘p. However, these classes were not known to have complete problems of a topological nature, which impedes any progress towards settling the complexity of the Necklace Splitting problem.
On the contrary, topological problems have been pivotal in obtaining completeness results for PPAD and PPA, such as the PPAD-completeness of finding a Nash equilibrium (Daskalakis etÂ al., 2009; Chen etÂ al., 2009b) and the PPA-completeness of Necklace Splitting with 222 thieves (Filos-Ratsikas and Goldberg, 2019).
In this paper, we provide the first topological characterization of the classes PPA-pğ‘p. First, we show that the computational problem associated with a simple generalization of Tuckerâ€™s Lemma, termed pğ‘p-polygon-Tucker, as well as the associated Borsuk-Ulam-type theorem, pğ‘p-polygon-Borsuk-Ulam, are PPA-pğ‘p-complete. Then, we show that the computational version of the well-known BSS Theorem (BÃ¡rÃ¡ny, Shlosman, and
SzÃ¼cs, 1981), as well as the associated BSS-Tucker problem are PPA-pğ‘p-complete. Finally, using a different generalization of Tuckerâ€™s Lemma (termed â„¤psubscriptâ„¤ğ‘\mathbb{Z}_{p}-star-Tucker), which we prove to be PPA-pğ‘p-complete, we prove that pğ‘p-thief Necklace Splitting is in PPA-pğ‘p. This latter result gives a new combinatorial proof for the Necklace Splitting theorem, the only proof of this nature other than that of Meunier (2014).
All of our containment results are obtained through a new combinatorial proof for â„¤psubscriptâ„¤ğ‘\mathbb{Z}_{p}-versions of Tuckerâ€™s lemma that is a natural generalization of the standard combinatorial proof of Tuckerâ€™s lemma by Freund and Todd (1981). We believe that this new proof technique is of independent interest.
